meanings.definition: A small pocket attached to a key ring.
meanings.sent1: I keep my spare change in the fob on my keychain.
meanings.sent2: She found her lost earring in the fob of her bag.
meanings.sent3: The tiny fob on his necklace held a secret message.
meanings.sent4: The fob on the bracelet was a hidden compartment for a tiny photo.
meanings.sent5: The antique fob on the key ring was beautifully engraved.

meanings.definition: A short chain or ribbon attached to a pocket watch.
meanings.sent1: The fob on his watch was made of shiny silver.
meanings.sent2: She inherited a gold fob from her grandfather's old pocket watch.
meanings.sent3: The fob on the pocket watch jingled softly as he walked.
meanings.sent4: The intricate design on the fob of the watch was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The fob on the antique pocket watch was delicately engraved with flowers.

meanings.sent1: He tried to fob off the fake watch as a genuine one.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to be fobbed into buying something she didn't need.
meanings.sent3: The magician managed to fob the audience with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: She could see through his attempt to fob her with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The con artist tried to fob the unsuspecting tourists with a fake treasure map.
